answers.a: Milk of magnesia is a suspension of magnesium hydroxide (which forms when magnesium oxide reacts with water), commonly used as an antacid and osmotic laxative.

answers.q: what is magnesium oxide good for
answers.a: In foods (E530) it prevents caking and helps regulate acidity, and it can provide magnesium for fortification or supplements; medicinally it also neutralizes stomach acid as an antacid.

answers.q: what is magnesium oxide used for
answers.a: As a food additive (E530) it’s used mainly as an anti-caking agent and acidity regulator, and as an approved magnesium source in supplements or fortified foods. It is also used in OTC products as an antacid.

answers.q: what is milk of magnesia used for
answers.a: It’s used to neutralize stomach acid for heartburn/indigestion relief and as an osmotic laxative for occasional constipation.

answers.q: how long does milk of magnesia take to wear off
answers.a: As a laxative, it typically produces a bowel movement within 30 minutes to 6 hours and the effect resolves within about a day; antacid relief usually lasts 30 minutes to a few hours depending on stomach contents.
